text:
Hey y’all!

I’m really really really into creating social media content, and I’m a self-learner.

I’d really really really love to hear your thoughts and feedback on the cute (I think it is) article I’ve written about SMM.
<https://blog.uvodo.com/how-to-get-the-most-out-of-social-media-to-grow-your-business-e5870ecb185d>

Aaannd, I’d love see your medium/personal blogs and read what do you love writing the most. Feel free to share w/ me :innocent:

attachments.title: How to get the most out of social media to grow your business?
attachments.text: What you know about your social media marketing activities.. you may have been wrong…
attachments.fallback: Medium: How to get the most out of social media to grow your business?

text:
Hi folks,  I’m not technically a content marketer but joined a while ago and it's been really interesting to observe things!

I run <http://Advisable.com|Advisable.com> - a freelancer discovery platform focused on marketing.

One thing we’re trying to do is to educate our clients to take a more conscientious approach to hiring freelancers. Basically, lots of people come to us saying they want to hire “a content writer” because they feel like they should “do content” - without a clear goal of what they want to achieve and vision for how they can achieve it.

Frustrated with this attitude, I wrote an article that aims to kinda change their minds on this and explain to them how they can build a vision for a differentiated content approach and then work with an incredible content marketer to flesh out and implement that approach - powered by our platform hopefully!

It aims to be slightly provocative but I’m unsure if it pulls that off right now so I’m looking for some perspectives.

While it’s technically aimed at clients, I’d hope that great content freelancers will appreciate our approach to.

You can check it out there: <https://advisable.notion.site/You-probably-shouldn-t-hire-a-content-writer-353e035a861748f7b393e5d1b3d94c60|https://advisable.notion.site/You-probably-shouldn-t-hire-a-content-writer-353e035a861748f7b393e5d1b3d94c60>

If you have time to check it, any feedback would be *hugely* appreciated!

attachments.title: You probably shouldn't hire a content writer
attachments.text: If you want to create great content, you probably shouldn't hire a content writer.
attachments.fallback: Advisable on Notion: You probably shouldn't hire a content writer

text:
I like this!
But would probably stress even more it’s less the writer and more the *mandate/reason/strategy for content that will create succes*s maybe earlier on in the article? or highlight with a subtitle? I think that’s the crux and the intro focused on a vs. the writer. …when really want they have to stand up on is important
